channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1693] Wedding Photography Fail
[+1540] Why Real ID is a Really Bad Idea
item.description: A critical look at why Blizzard's new Real ID system is going to do more harm than good.

item.title: [+1510] Teachers in 1960 vs 2010
[+1306] Twilight Almost Cost Me My Wife (and My Life)
item.description: There are two kinds of people in this world: those who want to eradicate everything associated with Twilight from the face of the earth and those responsible for polluting the public consciousness with its blood-sucking adolescent melodrama.

item.title: [+1285] Exclusive: Mike Judge Working On New 'Beavis and Butt-Head'
item.description: REVIEWniverse has exclusively learned from an anonymous source that Mike Judge is currently outlining 30 new episodes of his iconic animated comedy Beavis and Butt-Head for its native network. The source conceded that plans for actual broadcast are not yet cemented....

item.title: [+1212] The Steam Effect
item.description: With gaming companies taking every possible measurement to prevent privacy, with such things as DRM forcing you to have an active internet connection, how does Steam get away with it's paid service while profiting.

item.title: [+1113] I’m a Shroom and I hate this game
[+899] Debunking the Top 10 Energy Myths
item.description: The road to clean energy is full of enticing opportunities—and perilous pitfalls. Picking the best path requires avoiding both starry-eyed hype and cynical fatalism. In this special report, PM debunks 10 of the most pernicious myths that could derail our progress.

item.title: [+812] I'll Huff and I'll Puff... OH YEAH! (PIC)
item.description: Apparently, there's more than one way to blow a house down.

item.title: [+687] Best Buy says employee that made YouTube videos can keep job
item.description: "An animated video became a YouTube sensation, but put a Best Buy employee in hot water with his employer. On Tuesday, the retail giant released a statement, saying the popular videos will not cost Brian Maupin his job. The 25-year-old graphic art student is still weighing his options. The videos are parodies of rival cellphone carriers, told ..."

item.title: [+661] WTF - Nigerian man arrested with bags carrying 70 dead babies
item.description: A man working for Lagos University Teaching Hospital is arrested in Nigeria, carrying bags with more than 70 dead babies. The worker was allegedly trying to dump the corpses as he could not afford burial fees.

item.title: [+617] Conan reacts to Emmy nomination (pic)
[+611] The Lohan Verdict With Subtitles: What Her Lawyer Said
item.description: Lindsay Lohan was unable to control her emotions. Her lawyer, was a study in poker-faced calmness. We lip read to discover what she was saying.

item.title: [+598] How a Supreme Court Ruling Has Reshaped Campaign Finance
item.description: Until January this year, if companies such as ExxonMobil or Walmart wanted to throw their weight around in federal elections, they could encourage employees to contribute their own money to a PAC. Now they can simply go into the district of a member of Congress who is giving them a hard time and spend as much money as it wants to defeat them.

item.title: [+593] Who's there hover cat? [PIC]
[+557] The biggest sci-fi blockbusters that still lost money
item.description: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, made more than $938 M at the box office yet still lost $167 M, thanks to the magic of what is commonly known as "Hollywood accounting". We thought we'd look at other sci-fi and fantasy favorites that have yet to turn a profit despite raking in gazillions. Do the math yourself...

item.title: [+544] The iPhone Is Ruining My Life!
item.description: Despite rave reviews and millions sold, Apple's iPhone has become notorious for falling short in one key area -- the phone. Why all those dropped calls could be costing us a lot more than you think.

item.title: [+528] Sometimes you have to shovel sh!t before you land THE job
item.description: Scott Nicholson, a 24-year old Colgate University graduate has been living with his parents while searching for a job. He was offered $40,000, but declined! A young man who turns down a $40K/year job because it's a "dead end?" Suck it up buttercup. Take any job you can get while you try to find a better one. And beggars can't be choosers.

item.title: [+517] Found footage: Stop-Motion iPhone 4 Disassembly
item.description: Created by repair firm Techrestore and composed of over 1,700 still photos, this is a highly entertaining stop-motion disassembly of Apple's latest gadget.

item.title: [+510] Lego Street Shootout
item.description: I am usually not a huge fan of stop-motion animation but this is probably the coolest one I have ever seen.
